    • Method Detail

      • binarySearchBy

        public static <T,TKey> int binarySearchBy(java.util.List<T> source,
                          TKey key,
                          Selector<T,TKey> selector,
                          java.util.Comparator<TKey> comparator)
        Searches the specified list for specified object by specified key selector and comparator. The list must be sorted into ascending order according to the specified key selector and comparator(as by the Enumerable.orderby method), prior to making this call. If it is not sorted, the results are undefined. If the list contains multiple elements their key equals to the specified key, there is no guarantee which one will be found.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type
        TKey - the generic type
        Parameters:
        source - the list to be searched
        key - the key to be searched for
        selector - the selector for selecting key of element
        comparator - the comparator by which the list is ordered.
        Returns:
        the index of the search key, if it is contained in the list; otherwise, (-(insertion point) - 1). The insertion point is defined as the point at which the key would be inserted into the list: the index of the first element greater than the key, or list.size() if all elements in the list are less than the specified key. Note that this guarantees that the return value will be >= 0 if and only if the key is found.

      • binarySearchBy

        public static <T,TKey> int binarySearchBy(java.util.List<T> source,
                          TKey key,
                          Selector<T,TKey> selector)
        Searches the specified list for specified object by specified key selector. The list must be sorted into ascending order according to the specified key selector and comparator(as by the Enumerable.orderby method), prior to making this call. If it is not sorted, the results are undefined. If the list contains multiple elements their key equals to the specified key, there is no guarantee which one will be found.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type
        TKey - the generic type
        Parameters:
        source - the list to be searched
        key - the key to be searched for
        selector - the selector for selecting key of element
        Returns:
        the index of the search key, if it is contained in the list; otherwise, (-(insertion point) - 1). The insertion point is defined as the point at which the key would be inserted into the list: the index of the first element greater than the key, or list.size() if all elements in the list are less than the specified key. Note that this guarantees that the return value will be >= 0 if and only if the key is found.
